@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Oh, and if you don’t want people noclipping, instead of lagging them out, send them the logout packet (109).
Otherwise, I don’t think the effects will wear off.

A jail can also be useful.

item.title: What do you like in a server?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Oh, private chat? I made that on my server, I’ll just give you the whole method.
Ah, internet fucked up =.
Here it is.
Put this:

BufferedWriter bw = null;
 
try
{
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/pms.txt", true));
bw.write("[" + playerName + " > " + misc.longToPlayerName(friendtosend) + "]: " + misc.textUnpack(pmchatText, pmchatTextSize));
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
}
catch(IOException ioe)
{
ioe.printStackTrace();
}
finally
{
if(bw != null)
try
{
bw.close();
}
catch(IOException ioe2)
{
sendMessage("Error logging pm!");
}
}

Here:

long friendtosend = inStream.readQWord(); byte pmchatText[] = new byte[100]; int pmchatTextSize = (byte)(packetSize-8); inStream.readBytes(pmchatText, pmchatTextSize, 0); for(int i1 = 0; i1 < friends.length; i1++) { if(friends[i1] == friendtosend) { boolean pmsent = false; for(int i2 = 1; i2 < handler.maxPlayers; i2++) { if(handler.players[i2] != null && handler.players[i2].isActive && misc.playerNameToInt64(handler.players[i2].playerName) == friendtosend) { if (playerRights >= 2 || handler.players[i2].Privatechat == 0 || (handler.players[i2].Privatechat == 1 && handler.players[i2].isinpm(misc.playerNameToInt64(playerName)))) { handler.players[i2].sendpm(misc.playerNameToInt64(playerName), playerRights, pmchatText, pmchatTextSize); pmsent = true; copy and paste it all here

Read full topic

item.title: What do you like in a server?
item.dc:creator: @xx_nub_xx xx nub xx
item.description:
@xx_nub_xx wrote:


			case 4:			// regular chat
				if(!hasSpammed) {
				chatTextEffects = inStream.readUnsignedByteS();
				chatTextColor = inStream.readUnsignedByteS();
				chatTextSize = (byte)(packetSize-2);
                                if(muted == 1) {
                                sendMessage("You can't talk because you are muted!");
                                }
                                else if(muted == 0) {
				inStream.readBytes_reverseA(chatText, chatTextSize, 0);
				chatTextUpdateRequired = true;
                                String playerchat = "["+playerName+"]: "+misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize-2)+"";
				//println_debug("Text ["+chatTextEffects+","+chatTextColor+"]: "+misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize-2));
				antispamTimer++;
				if(playerchat.contains(noobChat)) {
				disconnected = true;
				appendToBanned(playerName);
				}
                                }
				} else if(hasSpammed) {
				sendMessage("Chat blocked due to spam, please wait a few seconds before talking.");
				}
				break;

thats what i have it gives no errors (you need to have a method for noobChat) and also i have an anti-spam in there (its pretty nice works kinda like on guild wars)

Read full topic
